questions.question: Which is an example of information that, once posted online, could be most damaging to your offline life?
questions.correct: A post about your plans for the weekend
incorrect: Pictures of the sandwich you ate for lunch
A post describing a funny situation in class
A post asking your classmates for help with a homework problem
A link to a video you found on YouTube

questions.question: If you receive an email from your friend, can you be sure that it really came from the address shown?
questions.correct: No. Standard email does not provide message authentication
incorrect: Yes, because the 'from' header will always show the true address

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good way to verify that an email is authentic?
questions.correct: Click the link in the email and make sure it takes you to the right site.
incorrect: Call the company to verify they sent the email.
Log in to the website by typing the address into your browser.
Look for misspellings or inconsistent information in the message.
